subject: AI
title: Temperature & Sampling
description: Control randomness to get creative or deterministic results.

hook.text: You run the same prompt twice and get different answers. Sometimes that's great (brainstorming). Sometimes it's terrible (data extraction). You need a dial.

buildup.text: Temperature controls randomness. Low temperature (0â€“0.3): the model picks the most likely token every time â€” deterministic, predictable. High temperature (0.7â€“1.0): more variety, more creativity, more risk.

discovery.text: For code generation and factual Q&A, use low temperature. For creative writing and brainstorming, go higher. Match the setting to your tolerance for surprise.

twist.text: Temperature 0 doesn't guarantee identical outputs across API calls â€” sampling and batching can still cause small differences. Close to deterministic, not perfectly deterministic.

climax.text: Set temperature as a conscious choice, not a default. It's one of the highest-impact parameters you can tune, and most people never touch it.

punchline.text: Low temp for facts. High temp for ideas. Know which mode you're in.

quiz.question: What does lowering the temperature parameter do?
options: Makes the model pick more likely tokens, reducing randomness
